boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse: Promo cards
boardgame.description:
3 new characters

German version:
- Verrückter Feuerwehrmann - Alle Spieler werfen alle Suchkarten aus ihrer Hand ab.
- Revolverheldin - Füge bis zum Ende deines Zuges 2 Schaden zusätzlich zu.
- Jäger - Ziehe 1 Suchkarte von 1 beliebigen Stapel.

English version:
- Crazed Fireman (Boss) - Short Range - Draw: Player must discard all scavenge cards from their hands.
- Gunslinger - Red's Rage - Action: Increase all damage by 2 until the end of your turn.
- Hunter - Scavenge - Action: Draw a scavenge card from any deck.

boardgame.name: Vulcania - Beyond the Storm - Quickstorm Scenario
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Vulcania rpg's scenario

boardgame.name: Vulcania - Essential
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Alternate quckstart ruleset for onlinr gaming

boardgame.name: ZHED
boardgame.description:
User Summary

ZHED is an abstract puzzle game with the goal of getting one of the squares onto the objective. You can move a square on the board in any cardinal direction and create a path of squares. If there is already a path laid down in that direction, you can skip over that square for "free". In this way, you create the ability to move squares further and further in order to obtain your goal.

boardgame.name: Risen Osiris: Sacred Numbers
boardgame.description:
A mini expansion to the micro solo roll & write game, Risen Osiris. Select a card and incorporate into the base game using the same dice rolling mechanic.

---
Instructions:

Using numbers that were considered powerful by the ancient Egyptians, these cards are meant to add some more variety to Risen Osiris gameplay.

Select any card from the expansion and cover the boxes under the Canopic Jars location and roll for the new numbers in the expansion boxes as normal.

Exception: In Sacred Fours, when rolling 12s, you can place a cube in the corresponding Canopic Jar instead of moving a yellow cube to Set’s Pyramid.

boardgame.name: Bismarck Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Command the pride of the German Navy in Bismarck Solitaire, an Original Bookgame by Worthington Publishing. Lead the German ships Bismarck, Prinz Eugen, and U-boat support as they take on the determined Royal Navy with one goal, Sink the Bismarck!

You have 8 missions of varying objectives and difficultly, plus two training cruises. Each mission gives you 3 tries to best the Royal Navy. Some missions require you to find convoys, others expect you to sink a few British warships, while some just hope your ships can survive the sortie.

Bismarck Solitaire is a pen and book game. In the book you get a map and orders. You roll dice to see events, move your ship, fight battles, and resolve events. The only thing you must provide is 2 dice, a pen, and a sense of adventure.

A turn is this:

Roll 2 dice and cross reference it to a chart to see events.
Resolve the events.
Fight any battles.
Plot your movement on the map.

Each mission gives your victory conditions. Once you obtain your victory conditions the game is over. Play missions over and over as no two games are the same.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sternenspiel
boardgame.description:
Players begin on the red outer lane. Each players rolls dice and moves along the outer lane. If you end your turn on a black star, you can switch to the yellow inner lane on the next turn. If your token meets an occupied space there, you must switch back to the red outside lane. Pieces on yellow stars may not be captured, but can be on black stars.

The first player to move all of his stones to the central star wins the game.

A variant of "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".


Variante von "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".
Gewürfelt wird reihum. Wer seinen Zug auf einem schwarzen Stern beendet darf im nächsten Zug auf die gelbe Innenbahn wechseln. Wenn sein Spielstein dort auf ein besetztes Feld trifft, muss er wieder auf die rote Außenbahn wechseln. Spielsteine auf gelben Feldern dürfen nicht geschlagen werden, auf schwarzen Feldern ist dies aber möglich.
Wer zuerst alle seine Steine auf den zentralen Stern befördert hat gewinnt das Spiel.

boardgame.name: Blood in the Valley: Campaign Supplement
boardgame.description:
This is a supplement for the main rulebook “Blood in the Valley”.

You will be able to conduct campaigns with your armies and fight multiple battles! This Campaign Supplement is D6 based.

You will feel like an American Civil War General commanding your armies and leading them to battlefield glory!

This Supplement is available at WargameVault as a pdf download!

boardgame.name: Володар Семи Земель (Ruler of The Seven Lands)
boardgame.description: This unique strategy game gives everyone the opportunity to try themselves as a leader and strategist. Choose a character and immerse yourself in the world of historical events! Maybe you can gather the warriors on a campaign. how did Prince Oleg do it? Then choose yellow chips and prepare boats for your army. If you like the heyday of Kievan Rus. choose brown chips and start acting on behalf of Prince Yaroslav the Wise. And if you think that only the rich experience of modern man can be useful to you, choose blue chips and try to compete on your own behalf! Combine tactical tricks with strategic abilities. Appropriate new lands and take care of strong rears. Build a powerful country!

boardgame.name: Space Base: The Mysteries of Terra Proxima
boardgame.description:
A New addition to the galaxy and A New Way to Expand Your Game!

Merging the power of Shy Plutonium with new starship technologies has allowed the U.E.S. Science Corps to reach the distant stars of Alpha Centauri, and discover the planet Terra Proxima. Strange ruins and vast fields of fungi cover much of the planet. Eager for knowledge, the U.E.S. authorizes colonization!

Welcome to the second installment of Space Base™ Saga Expansions. This is a collection of games with a linked story that introduce new content to Space Base™ via a narrative are included as well. Once the story is completed, it may be structure. Not only are new ships added, but new scenarios replayed or the contents may be added to your Space Base™ core set.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
Title: Space Base: The Mysteries of Terra Proxima Publisher: Alderac Entertainment Group Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Ransom Notes
boardgame.description:
A creative party game for making hilariously terrible sentences. Players respond to outlandish situations like "Tell someone you've clogged their toilet at a party" with just their limited pool of word magnets, leaving even master wordsmiths no choice but to create awesomely horrendous phrases. With hundreds of word magnets included, every round is always fresh, wildly creative, and tears-streaming-down-your-face funny.

Each round, the player judge picks a situation and players try to come up with the best answer from their pool of magnets. Each is presented and the judge picks a winner. The game ends at a pre-determined number of rounds the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Drug Czars
boardgame.description:
The game of international drug interdiction by the U.S.

U.S. player attempts to prevent the Drug Czar player(s) from importing their contraband without turning America into a police state, while the Drug Czars attempt to get rich while avoiding arrest and their fellows.

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard: Dice Tower
boardgame.description:
High-quality laser-cut wooden dice tower to help you with all those important rolls during planetary
exploration!

Made from wood (HDF)
For self-assembly with a manual inside

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard: Dice Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Dice replacement for standard dice found in Core Box and Stretch Goal Box
Over 70 high quality, two-color acrylic dice with “galaxy” effect.

Upgraded dice come instead of standard dice

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard: Playmats
boardgame.description:
A set of four unique playmats to help organize the play space.
Acts as an organizer for different decks and components you need to keep close by when playing ISS Vanguard.
Different design for each section.
Each playmat will be at least 410x320 and stitched on the edges.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard: Section Pets
boardgame.description:
Four section-themed alternative P.E.T models that you may use to replace a generic P.E.T design used in the base game. Please note: this expansion does not increase the amount of P.E.T robots you can have on the Planet Board at the same time.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Neoprene Playmat
boardgame.description:
This deluxe stitched neoprene playmat will give you a more comfortable experience (includes room for common supplies and each player's materials).

Contains one single-sided neoprene playmat sized roughly 120*90cm.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – 3D Printed Color Tokens Set
boardgame.description:
These 3D tokens will make your game even more luxurious and durable with plastic replacements that you can use for your games!

This add-on replaces tokens from the Core Box and all the game expansions. It contains 209 tokens split-up as follows:

• 2 Bomb Tokens
• 15 Control Tokens
• 2 Fortified Entryway Tokens
• 2 Reroll Tokens
• 30 Wound Tokens
• 5 Tactical Gadget Tokens
• 24 Special Gadget Tokens
• 66 Hidden Operators Tokens
• 63 Entryway Overwatch Tokens

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Dice Set
boardgame.description:
This 7-dice set complements the Core Game’s dice. That way, attackers and defenders will have their own set! This add-on also comes with a blue pouch.

Contains:
• 7 Dice
• 1 Velvet Pouch with the 6: Siege logo

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – 3D Decor Set
boardgame.description:
This set replaces the cardboard material with realistic plastic furniture and obstacles to enhance your games!

Contains 39 Paintable Miniatures
• 17 Core Box Furniture and Obstacles
• 10 Core Box Breach Standees
• 6 Concrete City Map Expansion Furniture
• 6 Dead End Map Expansion Furniture

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Zero Box
boardgame.description:
This iconic Operator comes as an iconic character...could it be Sam Fisher himself?

Comes with a profile, a miniature and all Operator components. Offered for free to Kickstarter backers who backed a Fresh Recruit pledge or a higher reward tier.

• 1 Alternate Zero Operator Miniature
• 1 Alternate Zero Operator Profile
• 1 Base Ring & Self-Adhesive Name Label
• 1 Entryway Overwatch Token
• 2 Special Gadget Standees (2 Argus Cameras for Zero)

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Duel Runner-up Box
boardgame.description:
Adds seven alternate Operators with their miniature, profile and linked tokens and components. These Operators are the runners-up from the skin duels: Ash, Sledge, Caveira, Dokkaebi, Maverick, Mozzie and Melusi.

Requires the Core Box to play. You'll get:
• 7 Alternate Operators Miniatures
• 7 Alternate Operator Profiles
• 7 Base Rings & Self-Adhesive Name Labels
• 7 Entryway Overwatch Tokens
• 6 Hidden Operator Tokens
• 8 Special Gadget Tokens (2 Banshee Sonic Defences for Melusi, 6 Holed Walls for Maverick)

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – Neoprene Dice Tray
boardgame.description:
Clip the dice tray together and roll your dice without fear of spillage! When putting the game back into the box, simply unfasten the clips to flatten the tray.

Contains:
• 1 Neoprene Dice Tray

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Divinus: Der Schatten des Yggrasils
Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil
boardgame.description:
Gather your friends and experience this 8 scenario prequel campaign, playing as four gods of the Norse Pantheon. Rewrite this epic story with your own choices and face the shadows lying beneath the ancient tree of life, Yggdrasil.

-description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil Recharge Pack

boardgame.name: Tchotchke Wars
boardgame.description:
Tchotchke Wars is a print and play game for two players.

You know when you are walking around a con and all of those little trinkets and business cards and tokens for games that you will forget in a month are weighing down your bag? Well now those become the power source your character will use to fuel it's fight! Are you at home and have a toilet paper roll, a raisin, a piece of lint, a remote control that doesn't work, and a dirty diaper? Congratulations you can play the game!

boardgame.name: Stone Age: GolonkoCrafts Premium Resources
boardgame.description: A set of upgraded resources, consisting of miniature wooden logs, real stone cubes, miniature ceramic bricks and gold bars made from brass.

boardgame.name: Barrage: GolonkoCrafts Water Droplets
boardgame.description: A set of 40 translucent droplets replacing the Barrage water tokens

boardgame.name: Trypophobia
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

For years, the small Pacific Northwestern town of Bleakwood has been as dependent on opioids as it is on the dying timber industry. Locals dubbed the economy "recession proof." That's starting to change. Many locals are kicking their habits and living healthier lives. But amidst this surprising turn of events, there's something strange going on. Why did a dead body turn-up covered in tiny holes? And why is the Sheriff covering it up? Your investigators will answer these questions and more as they learn the truth about who's behind the town's miraculous recovery.

Trypophobia is a system-neutral scenario designed for use with any investigative horror game.

boardgame.name: Gutenberg: GolonkoCrafts Deluxe Ink Tokens
boardgame.description: A set of 48 ink tokens (12 in each of 4 colors) and 4 big Caxton tokens to be used in Gutenberg game as cardboard token replacement

boardgame.name: Tekhenu: GolonkoCrafts Deluxe Resources
boardgame.description: A set of 60 real stone cubes (in 2 colors), 30 brass bars and 30 resin bread loaves. Replacing respective cardboard tokens.

boardgame.name: Red Cathedral: GolonkoCrafts Premium Resources
boardgame.description: A set of 20 miniature wooden logs, 20 mini ceramic bricks, 20 real stone cubes and 15 gold bars (made from brass) replacing respective wooden tokens

boardgame.name: Divinus: Base Game Recharge Pack
Divinus: Recharge-Pack Grundspiel
boardgame.description:
Thanks to this Recharge Pack, players are able to restart Divinus once they have completed its campaign. Using glue-less stickers for anything attaching to the tiles, and the board, only the player tuckboxes, the rulebook and a fresh sheet of stickers is needed to put your copy 100% back to a fresh start!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Badger and Coyote
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Badger and Coyote are good friends, even though they are very different creatures and live by different rules. They find working together to achieve their goals to be beneficial, and, many times, they enjoy each others company. Badger is focused and determined, while Coyote wants to play and socialize as much as find food.

Badger and Coyote is an asymmetrical (Badger and Coyote follow different rules) GMless duet game where each player takes a turn describing a scene and a complication that happens.

Players can speak to each other to narrate the story and the actions of Badger and Coyote, but Badger and Coyote cannot directly speak in-game. Instead, Coyote uses their social skills to help direct Badger. Badger has no social skills to communicate directly, but many skills to achieve the goals of obtaining food. They must work together to accomplish their goals!

boardgame.name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Fusion Strike
boardgame.description:
The path ahead is riddled with rivals and fierce battles. Fortunately, it also harbors limitless potential as the new Fusion Strike style emerges, capturing the unbound spirit of Pokémon and Trainers alike! Adaptable new Pokémon V like Genesect V, Hoopa V, and Mew VMAX are eager for battle, while Single Strike and Rapid Strike Pokémon loom large as Rillaboom VMAX, Cinderace VMAX, and Inteleon VMAX appear in their Gigantamax forms. Go with the flow and discover powerful new strategies in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Fusion Strike!
—description from the publisher

Adds over 260 new cards to the game.
—user summary

boardgame.name: Pokémon TCG: Celebrations
boardgame.description:
Celebrate some of Pokémon's greatest moments over 25 years of adventure, discovery, and friendship! The Celebrations expansion offers plenty to be excited about, including an opportunity to stroll down memory lane with classic Pokémon TCG cards. Add a joyous parade of Legendary, Mythical, and other beloved Pokémon to your collection, including Mew, Ho-Oh, Zamazenta, Flying Pikachu, and Surfing Pikachu. Join the party with the Pokémon TCG: Celebrations expansion!

- publisher's blurb


Adds more than 45 cards to the game.

- user summary

boardgame.name: The Clutching Hand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One of the city’s wealthiest men lies dead in the gutter, his head caved in. Even more troubling is that his right hand has been severed at the wrist and is missing. Who would have desecrated his corpse in this manner? And why did they take his hand?

boardgame.name: Aug 27, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Earthvault of the Therashard

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Aug 20, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Prison of the Lord of Fire

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: The Great City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A city of peace and prosperity, but now something is amiss.

The Great City is a detailed battlemap for Dungeons & Dragons or other tabletop RPGs. It's perfect for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry, as well as easy home printing! Plus, it comes with a detailed adventure prompt!

You can use this map in all sorts of ways – whether you want to play out an epic battle between dragons and humans or just have some fun exploring the city with a random encounter. This map will make any game more immersive than ever before! And if you’re short on time, we've also included an adventure prompt that'll help you create a story worth telling. So what are you waiting for? Get started today!

boardgame.name: Abandoned Underground City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve been tasked with exploring an abandoned underground dwarven city, and finding out what happened to its vanished inhabitants.

This map is perfect for any DM looking to add some depth and detail to their campaign. It’s also great for players who want an immersive experience. The tavern at the center of this map has been abandoned, but it still provides a sense of safety from the dangers that crawl up from below. You can find everything you need in this one package—just print or upload to your favourite VTT platform and play!

With this map, you can encounter monsters while your players explore the dark corners of the city. They’ll need to think creatively and use their environment to their advantage to survive down here. Get ready for hours upon hours of fun with your friends and family!

boardgame.name: Abandoned Sky City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve been tasked with exploring the ruins of a once-great city in the sky.

The city was abandoned long ago, and now it's just you and your party against the dangers that lurk within its walls. It’s up to you to find out what happened here, but be careful – this place is full of traps!

Explore the ruins for yourself by downloading Abandoned Sky City today! This battlemap comes with a detailed adventure prompt as well as easy home printing instructions so you can bring this ruined sky city into your game room or favourite VTT program fast.

Download Abandoned Sky City today and explore what could be one of the most dangerous places in all of D&D lore.

boardgame.name: Sky City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to explore a city in the sky?

Sky City is a map of a sprawling metropolis in the sky. It comes with an adventure prompt that will have your players exploring this floating metropolis to stop a deadly curse, and it's perfect for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry! It’s been designed with home printing in mind, so you can print out as many copies as you need.

You'll find all sorts of interesting places to explore on this map—from rickety timber walkways to a bustling tavern.

boardgame.name: Divinus: Neoprene Player Mats
boardgame.description:
Four individual neoprene players mats. Each mat is color-matched with artwork and colored stitched edging to match the player colors. The playmats are a large 34cm x 34cm square to comfortably fit the map tiles of each player.

The playmats are usable with games of Divinus including Shadow of Yggdrasil and Myth gameplay.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: City of Chained Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The City of Chained Horror is a map for your tabletop RPG campaign. It’s perfect for D&D, Pathfinder, and other RPGs that use miniatures on grid-based maps.

This battlemap features a beautiful city in the sky with a chained eldritch horror beneath it. You can print out this map to play on the table or import it into Roll20 or Foundry to play online!

Imagine what would happen if someone released the ancient god from its chains? What kind of horrors could be unleashed? There is a detailed adventure prompt written just for this map so you can get started right away!

boardgame.name: Ruined City of Chained Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an incredible battlemap for your next one-shot, with an easily hooked adventure prompt?

The Ruined City of Chained Horror is a realistic D&D battlemap for use in Roll20 or other VTTs, as well as easy-home printing. It comes with a long, detailed adventure prompt written just for it, located in a demi-plane so you can explore Lovecraftian themes without Call of Cthulhu!

This map is perfect for any game that needs an eldritch horror to unleash upon its players. With this map and the accompanying adventure, you can explore the ruins of a city in the sky where an ancient evil lies waiting to be unleashed once again... But beware—if you enter without caution, you may never return.

boardgame.name: Fortified Winter Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've been tasked with defending this outpost against the barbarians. What will you do?

The Fortified Winter Outpost is a detailed, realistic D&D battlemap of an outpost on a snowy slope. Lookout towers topped with ballista wait above a steep ridge overlooking a frozen plane filled with rocks and sharpened stakes to fend off barbarians. Ready for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry, as well as easy home printing!

This map has everything you need to create an epic adventure in your favorite VTT program like Roll20 or Foundry, or print it out at home for use in your game night! It's also perfect for anyone who wants to add some winter flair to their gaming sessions without having to draw every little detail themselves!

boardgame.name: Fortified Underdark Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Underdark is a dangerous place.

You need to be prepared for anything when you venture into the darkness below. That’s why we offer this fortified underdark outpost as a battlemap for your D&D games! This map includes everything you need to set up an epic encounter, including ballista atop lookout towers and glowing fungi lining the walls. It even has torches that illuminate the darkness so players without nightvision can see what lurks in the shadows.

If you want to make your game more realistic, or if you just want something new and different from all those handdrawn maps, then this map is perfect for you!

boardgame.name: Divinus: Dice Set
boardgame.description:
This Additional Dice Set gives you a second duplicate set of the 24 oversized demigod dice.

As you will be changing you base game dice during the legacy campaign, you will be unable to use these dice for Eternal Mode, Myth Scenarios, or the Shadow of Yggdrasil campaign until you have finished the main game campaign.

Having this additional set of dice will allow you to play games without impact your main campaign legacy dice.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fortified Swamp Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a new swamp to toss your players into?

Fortified Swamp Outpost is the perfect map for your next D&D session. It's got everything you need to make your players feel like they're in the middle of a swamp, and it's easy to use with Roll20 or Foundry!

You'll be able to print this map at home or use it in your favourite VTT, and have it ready for your next game night. The detail on this map will help bring your imagination alive as you play through an adventure. And don't worry about getting stuck in the mud—there are plenty of elevated lookout points where you can see what's coming before it gets too close!

boardgame.name: Fortified Mountain Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've been tasked with defending this outpost, or destroying it. What will you do?

The Fortified Mountain Outpost is a fully detailed battlemap of an outpost built into the side of a mountain. It includes lookout towers topped with ballista, set above a cliff that overlooks a valley beneath a layer of clouds. There is also an easy-to-cross bridge that spans from one mountain across the chasm to the fortress. This map is ready for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry, as well as easy home printing.

Will you choose to defend the fort against attackers? Or will you lead an army over through the cliffs and destroy from behind? Either way, this map has everything you need to make your next D&D session come alive.

boardgame.name: Fortified Forest Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Could you use a fortified forest outpost?

This battlemap is perfect for any DM looking to spice up their game with some extra terrain. With this map, you'll have everything you need to create an exciting and immersive session that will make your players feel like they're in the thick of it!

You can print out as many copies as you want with the eaasy-home-printing PDF, which comes with a square grid. You’ll also get all the files needed to run Roll20 or Foundry games online. Plus, it's easy enough for beginners to use too!

boardgame.name: Desert Ruins of the Great Maw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have debts owed to a cartel of thugs? The Desert Ruins of the Great Maw are a perfect place to try escape their planned execution! ;)

This map is designed to be used with virtual tabletop software like Roll20 or Foundry, but it can also be printed out and used at home. It also comes with a fun adventure prompt that will help you get started on your quest (which involves, we hope, NOT being eaten by the monster in the pit!).

If you’re looking for a new challenge with a bunch of laughs, this map is just what you need.

boardgame.name: Convicts & Cthulhu: The Misery Archive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the Misery, Collected in One Place.

Convicts & Cthulhu is a sourcebook designed to allow Call of Cthulhu Keepers and players to run scenarios and campaigns set in the penal colonies of early Australia. It particularly targets the historical period from 1795 to 1810, a time in which law and order played second-fiddle to greed and corruption. This was the depraved era which led ultimately to Australia’s first (and only) military uprising: the Rum Rebellion!

Since 2016, we have published over 500 pages of material for the Convicts & Cthulhu setting, encompassing source material, scenarios, historical NPC descriptions, prop documents, and even a Campaign frame. This Archive brings together everything we've created to date.

boardgame.name: 100 Avian Beasts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What would a campaign be without creatures to befriend or slay? Take to the skies with this list of avian beasts that are ready at your command, or ready to kill. From the tiniest humming bird to the largest of thunderbirds, these winged creatures will bring whimsy and excitement to your adventure. Or, if you've ever wanted to feel like a pirate with an enchanted parrot on your shoulder, this is the guide for you! Will you farm them for precious magical feathers, or ride them like a grand plumed steed? These birds, bats and beasts are ready to swoop in to take charge of any terrain. Add the flair of these feathered foes to your next campaign for a colorful twist your party won't see coming. Are you brave enough, or are you chicken?

boardgame.name: A Dekas of Alchemical Items (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of ten new alchemical items that characters could buy or craft, which may be useful in different situations, or which could be used against them by enemies.

boardgame.name: A Dekas of Alchemical Items II (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of ten new alchemical items that characters could buy or craft, which may be useful in different situations, or which could be used against them by enemies.

boardgame.name: A Dekas of Alchemical Items III (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of ten new alchemical items that characters could buy or craft, which may be useful in different situations, or which could be used against them by enemies.

boardgame.name: A Dekas of Alchemical Items IV (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of ten new alchemical items that characters could buy or craft, which may be useful in different situations, or which could be used against them by enemies.

boardgame.name: Azukail Games October 2021 Newsletter
boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in October 2021.

boardgame.name: Sewer Pipes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Military Base Exit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic Car Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Unbreak the H'earth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The search for Yeux, the missing kitten continues. The residents of a small Fey village have been seeing their dreams (and nightmares) come to life, and they’ve asked you to investigate why. A Four -Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

CONTENT WARNING: Heavy Combat. Discuss the possibility of retired characters before playing.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Dear Aery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A voice in your dreams sends you on a journey to discover what resides in the heart of one who was left behind. What role will you play in this?

A Four -Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Content warning: Trauma, Guilt, Loss of Loved one

This adventure was written using the Dungeoncraft programme using the "Create a Domain of Delight" option and is part of the D&D Adventurers League.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Grindhouse Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Fri Double Feature: The Crimson King & Isle of the Damned

From the back of the book:

These aren’t your typical Call of Cthulhu scenarios where some classy, well-dressed investigator sips tea and pours over leather books in some wood paneled library.

These are burning dumpsters of pure horror where a fleeing private investigator limps through some filthy back alley on a busted ankle while a howling pack of mutants try to beat them to death with the limbs of their dead friends.

In other words, these are not for the faint of heart, and are intended for mature audiences only. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: Edge of the Endless Sea
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

AN ADVENTURE FOR 4 TO 6 CHARACTERS OF LEVELS 6 TO 8

The life of an adventurer isn't all about slaying dragons or saving the world from a dastardly wizard seeking to unleash dark forces. Sometimes it is just about finding the next paycheck. Maybe it means escorting a caravan through dangerous trade routes or searching for a lost heirloom at the behest of some noble.

In the northern port city of Knifepoint, there are plenty of jobs for a resourceful group of adventurers. The bustling shipping and trade business creates many employment opportunities. What could possibly go wrong? A new career path awaits you... if you have what it takes!

boardgame.name: Tierras Quebradas: Aventuras entre la Ley y el Caos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Juego de rol en un mundo dividido por las luchas religiosas y sometido a la ambición de los dioses.
...
Tierras Quebradas: Aventuras entre la Ley y el Caos es un juego de rol de fantasía medieval...que sitúa la acción en un mundo dividido por las luchas religiosas y sometido a la ambición de los dioses. Su eterno conflicto mantiene a los mortales que los adoran en una tensión política y social constante. En el momento histórico que sirve de ambientación al juego, esta presión está a punto de hacer estallar el equilibrio de fuerzas que se había mantenido durante casi dos siglos, y una nueva y devastadora guerra se cierne sobre el mundo conocido. Los dioses se aprestan a reunir fuerzas y a disponer sus piezas para el enfrentamiento que se avecina, echando mano para ello de sus vasallos humanos.
boardgame.rpg: Tierras Quebradas: Aventuras entre la Ley y el Caos

boardgame.name: America The New Game
boardgame.description:
America The New Game is a word game whose deck celebrates the United States of America, probably in conjunction with the 1993 Chicago World's Fair -- it being published in Chicago that year.

Its deck includes letters cards to cover the alphabet twice, in red and in black, and each letter has a different painting by the designer about an aspect of American history and heritage. About half the cards cover history, including Leif Ericsson, Columbus, the Mayflower, Declaration of Independence, first railroads, etc. The rest of the cards cover the geographic range of America: the cities Washington D. C., Chicago and New York; the Statue of Liberty, steamboats, Niagara Falls, cotton plantations, wheat fields, orange groves, farms, cattle ranches, etc. It also includes an American Flag wild card, and a rules card. The cards are bridge size, measuring 88mm x 57mm.

It has rules for two games. "America" plays like Gin Rummy, with players drawing and discarding until someone goes out by playing a 7-letter word. At that point, everyone scores a word from their hand with bonus points for longer words, and for names of American cities or states. The largest point total is awarded if the 7-letter word is "America". "Alphabet Rhummy" plays like normal rummy, letting you play words to the table once you have them, as well as add letters to existing words to make new words. The first player out of cards gets one point per card in everyone else's hands.

boardgame.name: まじかる☆キングダム (Magical Kingdom)
boardgame.description:
In the land of bread and magic, the queen has a dream: to create an ideal kingdom. Roll dice, gather resources, and use the power of your character and your tableau to build a kingdom worthy of praise!

This game uses the same system as Magical Bakery: A Conglomerate from Today, but includes additional content in its box to allow for more variety in setups and different potential for tableau building. (Note that each game is separate, and the two games cannot be combined.) Over the course of the game, you will gather resources and use them to play cards to your tableau, earning yourself victory points and additional abilities. The game ends after one player has at least 20 VP in their tableau; the player with the most points wins the game!

On your turn, you will roll three dice (or four, for one character), with seven different types of actions available. Dice can be used to acquire cards from a common market to your hand or to generate resources in three different types (gold, influence, and magic). Resources and dice together can be used to play cards from your hand into your tableau, or to build a legendary card. Resources can be used on their own to refresh the market or be converted into the other resource types. And cards in your tableau can be used to generate special effects. Use a combination of luck and strategy to build an engine that will push you ahead of the other players in the game in order to bring the most renown to yourself and the kingdom.

Cards are Chimera size (58x90mm).

boardgame.name: Tesoro y Gloria
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tres aventureros vacían sus jarras en una infame taberna de Nulenheim, no lejos de los puertos. La última moneda que les quedaba, invertida en una sucia bebida que el tabernero tiene la vergüenza de llamar sidra, y tras esto un negro porvenir. Desconocidos, extranjeros, parias, pero que juntos han visto relucir más oro que los kadifas de Erigion, los khanes kamcharios o los reyes filósofos de Ilendirion. Una espada al cinto por toda riqueza, y una mano fuerte con que empuñarla como toda herencia.

La puerta de la taberna se abre dejando entrar jirones de la niebla que vomita el Fatuen a través de los muelles en esta hora temprana. No se giran cabezas ni se cruzan miradas, porque todos son extraños en los muelles de Nulenheim. El desconocido avanza y se sienta con los tres aventureros que, ahora sí, miran al recién llegado. Ven en él una sombra, un rostro cubierto por una capucha gastada y una mano cubierta de anillos que sujeta una pipa. Esta prende repentinamente, a su destello se revelan dos ojos negros y los rasgos de quien ha visto mucho, y desearía olvidar más. Un conjurador.

El mago pega una larga calada, y ​mientras observa a los tres miserables con los que ha decidido compartir mesa, da libertad al humo de sus pulmones haciéndolo bailar ante su rostro. Cuando termina la danza, habla:

- Estoy buscando a alguien con quien compartir una aventura

boardgame.name: Carnival of Madness
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

On the evening of Friday, October 30th, 1970, you’re driving down the Aylesbury Turnpike in western Massachusetts, headed for the Carnival Pandemonium. Most of the folks there tonight are families and couples just out for a bit of fun, games, and a little spooky excitement, but others have far more serious or even sinister purposes.

Whatever your reason for being there, one thing is certain. Everyone at the carnival this evening will experience things unimagined in their darkest nightmares. You don’t know it yet, but the part you play may determine the fate of all humanity.

boardgame.name: Necropolis: A Cyber-Gothic Setting
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

They tell me the last guy to have seen a sunrise died last week. For as long as anyone else can remember, Necropolis has been shrouded in mists. You can wander the alleys or drive down the highways, but you always end up back downtown. No one knows when exactly the mists came or what they're made of. Some say it's an experiment in nanotech gone wrong, others say it's the souls of the dead, shredded by The Powers That Be like a legally damning document.
...
Necropolis is a cyber-gothic setting for The Sprawl. The player characters are cyberpunk professionals fighting corporations in a seemingly inescapable city which is possibly run by supernatural forces. To help establish this slight shift in focus, new moves for both the players and the MC are introduced as well as three new playbooks: The Sourcerer, The Necrotech, and The Mistwalker--for a bit of additional gothic weirdness.

boardgame.name: Distant Lights
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Build Borderworld Outposts

Distant Lights gives the busy GM the tools they need to fashion remote planetary outposts, secluded deep-space asteroid habitats, or brash colonial footholds on far-flung worlds. Tables and guides are provided for generating outpost adventure hooks, troubled NPCs, and restive native populations. Additional materials give players the prices and guides they need for establishing their own interstellar outposts on distand worlds.

While Distant Lights was written for the Stars Without Number role-playing game, the tools in this book are largely system-neutral, and usable with your own favorite gaming system or sci-fi setting of choice.

boardgame.name: Tamatoa
boardgame.description: A monster for Torchbearer.

boardgame.name: Moons of Ardan
boardgame.description:
Moons of Ardan is a city-building and management game where you rebuild and expand your civilization across moons in a real-time simulated planetary system.

You follow the Axonauts, the survivors of a generational ship that crashed on a lonely moon.
In the crash, most of the technology that served them got lost.

Help them restore their culture and reconnect with their homeworld by building a great wonder.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Incantations.
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Simple variant rules for being intensely magical all the time. Inspired by and for use with Micah Anderson's Bastards.

Be amazed and astounded by:

- New ways to craft and cast spells! (Even when you shouldn't!)
- Rituals to summon supernatural friends!
- Three d20.20 lists of magic Words for an endless variety of spells! (That's 1200 Words, so many!)

Follow your dreams, be a wizard!

boardgame.name: Space Cowboy
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A very simple business card-sized game for all your space western needs, inspired by the likes of Cowboy Bebop and The Mandalorian. All you need to play is a single d6 and some friends!

boardgame.name: Wretch
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A Simple Game About Graverobbing

Based on @NateTreme's beautiful and beautifully concise Prole, Wretch is a game about trying to escape a dungeon with your life and a hefty sack of loot. Inspired mainly by Dark Souls with a touch of Earthsea and Ghibli, where Health, Stamina, Magic, and your Equipment are all the same thing.

The only materials you need to play are a coin, a pencil, and some paper.

boardgame.name: Rapture: Angels Starter Box
boardgame.description:
One of the game factions.

The Angels were created by a civilization classified as Type III on the Kardashev scale - commonly refered as "gods" - in the center of the Milky Way. Originally entrusted with the cultivation and harvesting processes, the angels were further developed into combat units after the first confrontation with the Lhon'Dar.

Once the harvesting sphere has been successfully deployed on a planet, the angels are responsible for cleansing the planet and preparing it for the next cultivation.

The angels appear to absorb the light around them, which is why they always seem to be surrounded by darkness.

boardgame.name: Bang! The Great Train Robbery
BANG!: Velká vlaková loupež
boardgame.description:
Expansion for BANG! card game. This expansion is co-designed by Czech and Slovak players and brings new mechanic with train and station cards.

Station card are placed in row and contains cost for the railway wagon cards in this station. Train (row of train cards placed under stations) will come to individual stations - every time when Sheriffs turn begins train moves further. Each player can in their turn pay cost of station card for the train card under. This card is placed in front of that player and is considered as blue card for rest of the game, or until this card is removed.

boardgame.name: Birdy
boardgame.description:
Birdy can be played in two very different ways. Whether it involves matching colours and collecting birds or putting down bird cards on ones that have already been set out – both game variants promise loads of fun and develop children’s matching abilities.

Game 1: Feeding the birds
At the moment the birds can’t find anything to eat around them and need help from humans. Attract the birds with food so that they don’t have to go hungry. The 25 bird cards are shuffled and then spread out on the table face down. Three arbitrary cards are left face up so they are visible to all players, and the dice are
placed nearby.
The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He then chooses one of the 3 face-up cards and tries to attract the selected bird by rolling the matching colours. The player has a total of 3 attempts, and can set aside any matching dice with each attempt – and continue to roll the dice/die the remaining times. The picture of a birdhouse functions as a joker and can stand for any colour. The X on the die is a „Lame Duck“, and can’t be placed anywhere. If the player manages to cover all colours after rolling the dice (a maximum of) three times, he can keep the card – otherwise, he has to put the card back. It is then the next player’s turn. If the previous player was able to collect a bird, then a new card is turned face up, so that there are 3 cards face up again. The object of the game is to attract 3 of the same kind of bird.
The game ends when one player has attracted 3 of the same birds. That player wins the round. If none of the players succeeds, the one who has collected the most birds wins.

Game 2: Bird dominoes

Can you link all of the birds onto the long chain of birds? Try to be the first player to attach all of your birds to the long row of birds. The 25 bird cards are shuffled thoroughly and spread out face down on the table – one card in the middle is turned face up, and one die is placed nearby. Then each player is given 4 bird cards to start with.

The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He rolls with one die, and there are the following possibilities:

Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled matches a “free colour point” on the card in the middle and one of the bird cards that the active player has shows the same colour – very good, the bird card can be placed
Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled is not a “free colour point” or the active player doesn’t have a bird card that shows the colour – too bad, it’s the next player’s turn
Rolls a “Lame Duck”: The active player draws a “penalty card”
Rolls a joker: The active player can place an arbitrary card on a free and matching colour point


The player who is first to place all of his bird cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Erster Englisch
boardgame.description: For the first steps in the English language, you can play lotto or memory or bingo with the 36 picture cards, check the pronunciation if you want, and otherwise just play the usual classics and become familiar with the basic vocabulary. Accompaniment by an adult who speaks English is an advantage. The illustrations are child-friendly and interesting, the game principles familiar enough that one is not distracted.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Arlast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ruins of Arlast is a 5E adventure module designed with the 5th edition SRD for new players or starting characters. It is specifically designed to make use of two sets of terrain made by Dwarven Forge in four different configurations. Each configuration also has an accompanying Dwarven Forge product that can be optionally used to supplement that dungeon. While having the Dwarven Forge terrain is not required it will add significantly to your game experience.

Core Dwarven Forge Products:
Deluxe Starter Set - Zultar’s Gameroom (Encounter 1)
Classic Dungeon Remastered Core Set

Optional Dwarven Forge Products:
Kobold Tribe
Furnishing Pack
Texture Patches Variety Pack and Mimic Pack
Tiny’s Treasure Trove

This module is laid out with an introduction, four small ruins to explore and a conclusion. Both the introduction and conclusion take place in the village of Crystal Plains and provide set up and wrap up for the adventure. The four ruins are each their own small dungeon with an overarching story.

boardgame.name: Children of the Swamp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Children of the Swamp is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters with an average party level (APL) of 7, optimized for a party of four characters of 7th level.

The characters are tasked by a wealthy merchant family to investigate the disappearance of two of their children. The investigation will reveal naive dabbling in the occult and bring the characters face to face with a powerful coven of hags.

What's Included?
25-page PDF
3 full-color maps included in the PDF
Background
As with all families, some of the Windrows’ children have a tendency to get into trouble. Bella-Rose and Dion Windrow stole a book on the occult from a wizard that traveled through town months ago. In the time since, they studied the book to the best of their abilities and worked out how to locate a hag, which they believe will be able to use magic to help them. The hag they located lives deep in the swamps beyond their home. One night, long after everybody else had gone to sleep, the two snuck out and began making their way toward the hag’s lair. The following day, after a long and fruitless search, the Windrows set off into town to recruit help finding their missing children.

Unbeknownst to Bella-Rose and Dion, the hag they manage to locate is actually part of a coven that’s enchanted the swamp to lure wandering children safely to their lair while obfuscating travel to adults. The hag coven has amassed a veritable village of children that they’ve been grooming into propagators of their magic.

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 15
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Yvanka - femal ehuman guard
Martinet - male orc noble
Vak'kris - female orc wizard
Nellith - female elven blood mage

boardgame.name: Paths of Devotion II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sword Saint
Sword saints are warriors who walk the path already taken by another, looking to achieve such legendary skill that they, too, will be remembered by history. The true sword saints of the past were figures who achieved a level of skill beyond mastery in their craft. Though modern practitioners call themselves sword saints, this is only to draw a parallel between themselves and these heroes.

In practice, they would usually only call themselves warriors, fighters, samurai, or otherwise. It is unbecoming for them to address themselves as sword saints unless they are arrogant, but this does not always stop them. ‘Phantom saint’ is a term they commonly use, describing their emulation of an ancient swordmaster’s lifestyle, combat skills and practices until they come truly into their own.

As a class the sword saint relies heavilyon their resource, focus points, to perform a variety of techniques that help them to adapt to any situation. They rely on focus techniques, which each path of devotion features unique version and variants of.

The Sword Saint can be found at the link above! Just click on the emblem!

Paths of Devotion II
This document contains six new subclasses for the Sword Saint, each based upon a historic figure (with one exception, based on a lack of inspiration entirely). They are:

Gadabout. A Sword Saint who has fallen or strayed from their path, and no longer cares for anything except their personal gain and enjoyment.
Way of Chulainn. A druidic quarter-caster subclass that utilizes natural magic, has a tendency toward thrown weapons and can become a horrifying beast that embodies death.
Way of the Cindered Soul. Learning from a being who burned away their own soul to save a kingdom, this path imbues its practitioner with flames, endurance and a curse of undeath.
Way of Ittōsai. A swordsman who seeks to end conflicts in a single strike.
Way of Rebellion. Learning from the style of an infamous devil hunter, those who follow this path gain a variety of methods of combat and defense for many situations.
Way of the Wolf. Those who construct prosthetic devices that many lesser devices can be housed within, and deployed at will.
Along with these new paths of devotion, this document contains a saint myth weapon that corrosponds to each of these classes (except the Gadabout). These peices of equipment are artifacts, and though useful on their own are especially powerful in the hands of their designated sword saint.

boardgame.name: 20 Minor Magic Items #01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

20 Minor Magic Items contains 20 items of lesser or least magical sort, designed to be given to lower-level characters. Most of the Minor Magic Items listed herein are common or very common items of minor, lesser, or petty sort. One common or two very common items from this booklet can be substituted for any one common item from the standard treasure lists.

The 20 items are:

Adamantine-Chased Armor
Ammunition of Ready Recovery
Belt Pouch of Plenty
Crown of the Goblin King
Grenade of Wonder
Healing Salve
Holy Crackers
Instant Armor
Locket of Memory
Pastries of Provisioning
Phantasmal Pipe
Ring of Invisibility, Lesser
Ring of Truth
Ring of Warding
Rune Weapon, Lesser
Shielding Shield
Talisman of Resistance
Talisman of Protection
Thieves Tools Nonpareil
Tome of the Master

boardgame.name: Erstes Schreibspiel
boardgame.description:
A letter of the alphabet serves as a travel route for the ABC-mobile, in addition, there is a timetable on the letter card, which indicates in which order the stations must be completed. The letters have in principle no stations in the rounds, with the O the two stations are placed at the top, so that one accommodates them at all. On this basis, there are several game variants for one or more children, you can also lay and travel whole words. Whoever reaches the end of his timetable first and has been to all the stations on his letter card wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Canyonlands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There’s one crippled tank stranded in a maze of canyons out in the desert and a second which is not responding to comms. The PCs are the security force for the vehicle recovery team, tasked to protect them as they rescue the surviving tank crew and retrieve the tanks.

Canyonlands is a system agnostic (i.e. systemless) military science fiction scenario. Nothing is statted up – the idea is you use your favourite system and/or slot it into a campaign in whatever setting you fancy. Resources for the GM include:


Details of Delta Pavonis III – a planet largely consisting of desert (because there’s a supercontinent)
GM and player versions of maps (in colour)
Information on the Yitteral, the local alien species
A few dangerous animals the PCs might encounter in the area
Story seeds for follow up adventures


It is hard-ish science fiction, so the assumption when running the adventure is that there are no energy weapons. Think bullets and body armour, not lasers and forcefields. The PCs will be assumed to be firing bullets, shells, missiles, and grenades. Missing from the setting are artificial gravity, tractor beams and psionic powers. You can, of course, write these high-tech and science-fantasy tropes back into the scenario, but you might have to alter the enemy’s tactics to take account of them.

boardgame.name: Sarcophagi (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the sarcophagi in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Sarcophagi (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the sarcophagi in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Sarcophagi (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the sarcophagi in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Sarcophagi (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the sarcophagi in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Sarcophagi is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Wolf's Dragoons Assault Star
boardgame.description:
The Wolf's Dragoons are the most well-known and respected mercenary command in the Inner Sphere and their Mech Warriors are some of the most skilled and feared across hundreds of worlds. Once more, the Inner Sphere is poised for war and the Wolf's Dragoons are on the forefront.

This B&N Exclusive Expansion set includes the new Annihilator, as well as re-posed Timber wolf and Rifleman and new variants of the Archer and Blackjack BattleMechs - no assembly required - along with 10 MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards! Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: A Tale of Bravery
boardgame.description:
A story driven adventure game for 1 to 4 players set in fantasy Britain some 20 years after the death of King Arthur Pendragon.

Each separate game session, or “quest” as it is called in the game, takes about 1 hour to play. Each quest can be won, lost, or even forfeited. The game is over when you have played through all quests listed in a separate questbook.

Each one of the players controls a “hero”. There are four heroes to the so called “party”. The players win the game if they manage to complete the goals of all the quests of the game.

The players will take turns reading aloud from the questbook. At regular intervals the players are allowed to make decisions on where to go and what to do. This affects the outcome of the game session. Whenever a fight occurs, it is played out on a game board made of separate modular tiles. The combat system is quick and focused on tactics and using the hero’s abilities to survive.

During the course of the game the players will be able to improve their heroes abilities, and also her equipment and retinue.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: A Tale of Bravery: Demo Game

boardgame.name: Ich sehe was! Was siehst Du?
boardgame.description:
A game designed to help children read emotions of people especially during the Covid pandemic where faces are covered by masks.
Made by a childcare worker and designed for use in schools or other educational institutions. Comes with an app and other downloadable games that could be used with that cards set.

The game is more about learning and getting people interested into this topic.
However, the game flow and win condition are as follows:
You have the card pile in your hand and have to allocate the top card to one of the five emotions. Look at the back of the card to check if you were right. If you were right, keep the card and pass on the pile to the next player. If you were wrong put the card underneath the pile and pass it on. If the pile rans out of cards, the game ends. The player with the most cards win the game.

—user summary

Ein Spieler hat alle Karten, nimmt die oberste und rät, welche Emotion es ist. Liegt man richtig, darf man die Karte behalten und gibt die restlichen Karten weiter! Liegt man falsch, legt man sie unter den Stapel und gibt ihn weiter! Immer der Reihe nach! Wenn der Stapel durch ist, schaut man, wer am meisten Karten besitzt. Derjenige hat gewonnen!

—description from the designer (German)

boardgame.name: Quick Quiz: Querdenker
boardgame.description:
100 game cards with 250 questions.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Subjects: past times, world travel, animals up close, stars and starlets, would you have known?
Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: So werden Sie Weltmeister im Batterien-Verkaufen
boardgame.description:
This soccer game is played on a small field with 11 Nails on each side (representing soccer players) but which actually act as obstacles, a small steel ball and two plastic ice cream spoons to kick the steel ball. The players take turns trying to put the ball in the opponent's goal.
The player to score the most goals in an agreed time, wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Echoes of Chaos
boardgame.description:
From the book's overview:

Echoes of Chaos is a collaborative storytelling game about a group of time-travelling Tourists who set out on a disastrous expedition into the past and accidentally alter the future. In the game, the game master (GM) and the players work together to determine what happens, using dice rolls to determine how successful or unsuccessful various actions are. The GM does not roll dice in this game. Please note-Echoes of Chaos is a narrative-first game, the goal of these rules is to help guide the story more so than dictate it.

Echoes of Chaos tells the story of the greedy, dangerous, and potentially disastrous actions of the Tourists as they travel back in time to achieve a secret, personal objective. This can be everything from hunting a Tyrannosaurus Rex, to stealing a famous artifact at the time of its creation, to
attempting to become part of history by replacing (or killing) a major figure. Every major dramatic action creates an echo that will have drastic consequences on the future, but the Tourists don't care... at least, not yet. This
is the story of how these hapless Tourists loot the past and destroy the future: they may achieve their goal, but it will cost them dearly.

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Unbreakable Adventure Map
boardgame.description: The Break Adventure map allows you to track your progress points in an immersive visual world, replacing your Day Counter as you move the bead included in your core game box through the treacherous land under Daelore. Illustrated by primary TMB artist Anthony LeTourneau, this two-sided beautiful neoprene mat features labeled map of northern and southern Daelore as seen in the subterranean world of the Break.

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Unbreakable – Control ‘Ur Roll Dice Tray
boardgame.description: Give your every action in Too Many Bones an eerie abmience when you use your Chip Theory Games' latest neoprene dice tray, this one featuring the graphics themed to the dark world found in Too Many Bones Unbreakable.

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Collapsible Dice Tower
boardgame.description: The Chip Theory Games collapsible dice tower marries Chip Theory's premium componentry with storage convenience, combining a fold-up dice tower with the padded luxury of the company's Control 'Ur Roll dice trays. When you're done, simply fold it up and store it flat.

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Collapsible Dice Tower
boardgame.description: The Chip Theory Games collapsible dice tower marries Chip Theory's premium componentry with storage convenience, combining a fold-up dice tower with the padded luxury of the company's Control 'Ur Roll dice trays. When you're done, simply fold it up and store it flat.

boardgame.name: SCAVENGER: Nomads of Uncharted Worlds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SCAVENGER: Nomads of Uncharted Worlds is a 5th Edition campaign sourcebook. Players take on the roles of scavengers - punk daredevils and desperates who travel the dying, bronze age world of Akara and the alien world of Torn in search of a way to survive the extinction event that is the Cataclysm.

Found inside of this 237-page tome are:

The setting of Akara, complete with role tables, factions, NPCs, locations to explore, and strange mysticisms to practice!
The setting of Torn, which comes with 4 adventure locations, and 28 new magical items!
The Scavenger Suite, which details the base rules changes to the Scavenger setting, 6 new backgrounds, 13 new magical items, 3 new races (the Akaran, kith, and morg), and 4 new subclasses (the rogue’s Vermillion Hand, fighter’s Starfaller, warlock’s Core Entity, and druid’s Circle of Cataclysms)!
The new Expedition Experience system, rewarding scavengers not for what they kill, but for what they’re able to return back to their patrons!
A fully illustrated bestiary with 15 weirdling alien things for your scavengers to hunt!

boardgame.name: SCAVENGER: Crimson Catalyst
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SCAVENGER: Crimson Catalyst is an entirely player-facing supplement designed to bring the fantasy of the Scavenger universe to 5th Edition. It includes:


Four new subclasses, including the Alien Apex Ranger and the Path of the Vermillion Abomination Barbarian.
Dozens of variant class features, including replacing spellcasting with a new magic system for certain classes.
Cultural Tricks for creating authentic characters of Scavenger’s various rich cultures.

boardgame.name: Cacti
boardgame.description:
In Cacti, you are a bristly gardener seeking to create succulent arrangements in a community garden. Uproot cacti, and supplant pots to achieve the best botanical beauties. But your prickly neighbors have their own sorted assemblage in mind and will try to spoil your toils with their barbed ideas. Plot your preferred assortments in five passive aggressive rounds to gardening contentment.

On your turn, you will swap the position of two cards in the garden, then flip one of them to lock it in place (but losing its flower). End your turn by placing one of your four score cards face down to claim a row or column of cactus arrangements.

After five rounds, count your scores from all of your score cards and flowers in your claimed rows/columns. The player with the highest score wins the game!

Misdirect other players with your score cards, sabotage their arrangements, and hoard pots and cacti.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: The Automaton of Shale
boardgame.description:
How do you top our legendary Too Many Bones Logbooks? This is the only way we knew how!

The Automaton of Shale is a brand new Too Many Bones short story, told in verse by Logan Giannini and enhanced by beautiful pop-up art by Anthony Letourneau, with paper engineered by Sam Ita.

The book contains a unique Too Many Bones adventure, complete with new encounters, loot, baddies and a new tyrant to battle at the end of the adventure. These pieces may be played front to back as a singular adventure or mixed with your existing Too Many Bones content.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Road Trip
boardgame.description:
Road Trip is an 18 card solo game about a journey across the country. Find the most efficient route for your travels to make it the best road trip by arranging your 9 stops in geographical order (stop number) from left to right using Actions before your deck runs out.

Shuffle all 18 postcards together and set the Route by laying out a line of 9 face up going across the playing area. Set the remainder as the draw deck. Start your adventure by drawing three cards from the deck. Using the actions on the backs, play a card and adjust the Route accordingly. Then draw a new card to bring your hand back to three cards. Continue playing until you have rearranged the Route in order (win), or run out of cards in the deck (lose).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: OT Fantasy Draft
boardgame.description:
OT Fantasy Draft is a 2-5 player card drafting game where each player drafts a team of Old Testament characters, locations, and things that will create the best combos and score the most points. Games are quick and the rules easy to pick up, but the decisions will be hard!

A game of OT Fantasy Draft lasts for seven rounds. Every round begins with the Starting Player and then proceeds around the table clockwise until everyone has had a turn. On each player’s turn they will:


Take (draft) a card from the Draftline.
Place the card in front of themselves, forming their drafted team.
A new card is drawn from the top of the Draw Pile to replace the missing card. Play passes to the next player.


If it is the last player’s turn, instead discard the leftover cards in the Draftline, draw five new cards from the Draw Pile, and begin a new round with the player who went last the previous round.

After the end of the 7th round, players add their secret card to their Drafted Team and proceed to score their hand. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Divinus: Der Schatten des Yggrasils – Recharge Pack
Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil Recharge Pack
boardgame.description:
Thanks to this Recharge Pack, players are able to restart the Shadow of Yggdrasil expansion once they have completed its campaign. Using glue-less stickers for anything attaching to the tiles, and the board, only the player tuckboxes, the rulebook and a fresh sheet of stickers is needed to put your copy 100% back to a fresh start!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The City of the Steam Sun: The Curious Dr. Campbell
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An inexperienced Expeditionary Force squad has been given their biggest assignment. They are to dare the treacherous wasteland outside the city to find and rescue the brilliant scientist and technomage, Dr. Hugo Campbell. Creator of steam-powered factory automatons, Dr. Campbell is no friend to the common worker, but he is also on the bad side of City Council. The eccentric went into self-exile in the wastelands five years ago and might not be too eager to return. Can our heroes survive hordes of Insect Men, vicious Limbo monsters, and Dr. Campbell's servants to complete their mission?

The Curious Doctor Campbell is a detailed adventure for the City of the Steam Sun setting. It is intended for four to six seasoned characters who are either members of the Expeditionary Force or specialists contracted for this mission. The adventure will test their wits, their martial skills, their morality and loyalty.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Alpha Strike – Alpine/Lunar Hexless Battlemap
boardgame.description: This map is 34” x 22", The map is high-resolution with great color quality, making it one of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes an Alpine battlefield and the secondary side includes a Lunar battlefield.

boardgame.name: Rocket Wars
boardgame.description:
Fast-paced local multi-player game packed with action. Destroy your friends with all sorts of different weapons and power-ups across multiple game modes!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Oirbo
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




The game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer and remains in active development. Some information and gameplay elements may change in the future.




from press kit

Explore a labyrinthian spacecraft and discover its mysteries and purpose. Help Oirbo navigate a metroidvania inspired, hand-drawn, 2D action-platformer full of secrets to uncover, areas to explore and enemies to dismantle. The choices are yours to make, how will you unravel the twisted story?

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Legends – Houses of Morrowind
boardgame.description:
You have no idea what you've wandered into. From the moment you stepped off the docks in Seyda Neen, you became a potential pawn in a grand power struggle between the Great Houses that govern this land and even between the living gods themselves and their terrible ancient enemies. But of course, if it maneuvers correctly, a pawn can become a queen. Who will you trust? Who will you fight for? Can you control the Houses of Morrowind?

Houses of Morrowind is the second card expansion for Legends. It can be obtained by buying new card packs separate from the Core Set, which can be opened to earn 149 new cards themed after The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind and The Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind. It introduces cards for five of the ten possible three-attribute sets, each representing one of the major Houses, or factions, of Vvardenfell.

boardgame.name: NOVA
boardgame.description:
From Introduction

NOVA is a tabletop roleplaying game about exploring and rebuilding a world after the sun exploded. With NOVA, you and your friends tell the stories of the Sparks, brave individuals wearing exosuits, fueled by the sun, who venture out into the dark. Suit up and get your systems ready, you’re humanity’s last hope of a new dawn.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Legends – Alliance War
boardgame.description: Alliance War is the third card expansion for Legends. It can be obtained by buying new card packs separate from the Core Set, which can be opened to earn 104 new cards themed after the Alliance War in Elder Scrolls Online. It introduces cards for the remaining five possible three-attribute sets, each representing one of the major factions fighting for the Ruby Throne.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Legends – Jaws of Oblivion
boardgame.description:
Tamriel tears at the seams as conflict worsens between the Imperials of Cyrodiil and the Daedra-worshipping Order of the Mythic Dawn. From witnessing the rise of Martin Septim to braving Mankar Camoran’s eerie Paradise, Jaws of Oblivion immerses players in the world-shaking events of the Oblivion Crisis.

Jaws of Oblivion is the fifth card expansion for The Elder Scrolls Legends. It can be obtained by buying new card packs separate from the Core Set, which can be opened to earn 75+ new cards themed after the Oblivion Crisis of The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: Deluxe Playmat
boardgame.description:
Organize your Too Many Bones play with the Deluxe TMB Playmat. One side of this double-sided neoprene mat features positions for cards, the Battle Mat, Baddie stacks, Gearlocs, and more, even including accessories like the Adventure Mat. The other side features an attractive design perfect as a play surface for any experience.

- 1 Double-sided Playmat 34" x 49"

boardgame.name: Dangerous!
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Dangerous! is a simple tabletop role-playing game in just 2 pages of rules. The system is designed with short "one-shot" RPGs in mind and focuses on cinematic action and high adventure.

Some features of Dangerous!:


A quick resolution system using inverted dice pools (roll more dice for increasingly hard or dangerous tasks)



Character creation based on natural language



Player-facing, fast-playing combat rules

boardgame.name: The Hodgepocalypse Monster Manual and Book of Danger for 5e
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Hodgepocalypse monster manual also known as the Book of Danger. Here you find some monsters that might be familiar with some interesting change plus many more from our strange and twisted imagination. We've kept as many of the 5th edition rules for monsters as possible with some tweaks.

boardgame.name: The Seeker's Guide to Twisted Taverns
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

What's in the book? Welcome to a wondrous collection of 17 enormous locations, all collected and transcribed by The Seeker themself. Each tavern is fit to explore with its own questboard, history, staff, menu, numerous guests and more!

boardgame.name: Flights of Fancy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Aircraft Catalogue - Flights of Fancy

User summary:

Presents ten aircraft.

boardgame.name: Aircraft Catalogue Core
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Presents dozens of new aircraft for the game.

boardgame.name: Flying Circus Playbooks
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Presents print-and-play playbooks for the game, including: A Fisher, A Witch, A Farmer, A Soldier, A Believer, A Skyborn, A Student, A Survivor, A Scion, and A Worker.

Also includes various print-and-play play sheets and tracking sheets, airplanes, and other play aids.

boardgame.name: Brass: Eurohell Design 3D Locomotive & Barge Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Swap your cardboard markers with our 3D locomotives and barges and conjure up a real eye-catcher on your table.

14 x locomotive and 14 x barge per player color
Dimensions: ca. 2,9cm x 0,7cm x 1,2cm (L/W/H)

boardgame.name: The Taverns of Tiefenthal: Eurohell Design Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert language-neutral, can be stored vertically and is safe for transport.

Your player board directly on the table without puzzling together at the setup. All tiles can be taken out easily with gripping holes.

Do the tumbling dice also annoy you when you pass them on? Then here is the solution for you with our trays in player color!

Our card trays can be connected in modules, can be placed directly on the table and prevent fanning of sleeved cards.

Trays for each module!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Taverns of Tiefenthal: Open Doors
