boardgame.name: Anno 1800: Eurohell Design Insert
boardgame.description:
Workers with two magnetic trays and industries with 3 magnetic boards directly on the game board.

Islands overlap the game board and fit in perfectly.

Two trays of goods prevent over-the-table grabbing with multiple players. The worker trays are magnetically connected and fit right next to the plan.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Eurohell Design 3D Upgrade Compasses & Coins
boardgame.description:
For an extra tactile experience, replace your cardboard tokens with cool 3D tokens:

27 x compass with rotating needle
(2,1 x 0,4cm)
27 x weighted coins a 3.5g
(2,2 x 0,4cm)

boardgame.name: Back to the Future: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Join forces to get the Delorean to 88MPH and go back to the future! Clear all the Paradoxes by using Flux Energy. The problem is, all players are playing from the future and cannot communicate, you can only send signals!

Players need to work together to clear the Paradoxes by laying Flux Energy cards with different values to fulfill each Paradox objective, clearing it from the time continuum.

Each Paradox has a unique problem that must be fixed. Decode the paradox card and find out how to solve them. Once the requirements of the Paradox are met the Delorean is able to move to that space.

You must lay a card on your turn. You can play a card even if it does not help to fix a Paradox or if you cannot go or choose not to go you can reveal the next Paradox in the line. However this causes another Paradox to appear in the future!

boardgame.name: E.T. Phone Home: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Help E.T. phone home before the Agents find him. Work together using Action cards to inspect and manipulate the Movie Deck to find E.T.'s Phone parts hidden within.

On your turn, you play one action card and carry out each row of instructions from left to right, starting at the top. At the end of your turn draw back to 4 cards.

Find all 6 parts to save E.T. from the Agents scattered throughout the deck. If you find all 6 Agents and lose all of E.T.'s disguises, he will be captured and your mission will be over!

boardgame.name: Knight Rider: KITT vs KARR Card Game
boardgame.description:
Lifelong rivals KITT and KARR go head-to-head in a destructive battle for victory. Drain your opponent’s energy by racing around the map and performing stunts to either attack or defend.

Players choose a Drive card from their hand to
play face down. When flipped over, whoever has the fastest speed goes first. If the colour button matches your previous card you can choose to activate a stunt.

Stunts can be used to attack your opponent, defend an attack or move past or through roadblocks. To perform stunts, players have to perform trick-shots with their car discs.

boardgame.name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – reDrewno KS Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for KS version of Waste Knights: Second Edition
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Call of the Waste
Waste Knights: Second Edition – Dogs of War
Waste Knights: Second Edition – Paths of Blood
Waste Knights: Second Edition – Remnants of Civilization
Waste Knights: Second Edition – Through the Waste

boardgame.name: Museum Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
It’s the turn of the 20th century, the golden age of museums. As interest in and accessibility of museums grew exponentially, many institutions underwent an intense period of expansion on both an intellectual and physical level, searching to grow their collections for profit and science.

You play as a curator of one such museum and it’s your job to build the biggest, most coherent collection that you can in this game of collection and bartering featuring over 300 individual illustrations by Vincent Dutrait and authentic architectural facts. But it’s no simple task!

Each player in Museum has a small collection of relics to get them started, after which, they will have to send explorers around the world to uncover others. These relics each have a value which is either the cost to add them to your museum, or how much they contribute towards adding other relics to your museum. “Spent” Relics are added to your reserve. You can withdraw them from it by exchanging them for an equal number of items; however, your opponents also has access to your reserve!

During the game you will be required to assemble different collections. These can be from different categories (war, agriculture, architecture, etc) or periods (Ancient Egypt, Rome, Aztec, etc). Patron cards will give you bonus cards for amassing certain collections. Explorer cards will allow you to hire famous archeologists to confer bonuses to your museum and event cards will provide you with some game changing circumstances that you’ll have to work around, based on historical events!

All these different elements make compiling your collection an interesting and sometimes tricky experience! At the end of the game points are scored based on collections and their value and the player with the most points wins!

Deluxe Editon holds all Museum Expansions

boardgame.name: Baltic Empires: The Northern Wars of 1558-1721
boardgame.description:
Baltic Empires is an approachable 2-5 player strategy game about conflicts between the states of the Baltic region during the early modern era, a transformative period of religious conflict, large scale warfare, and constant struggles for power. Players will have to develop their economy, strengthen their administration, secure trade hubs, and finally build armies to become the dominant power of the Baltics. Denmark-Norway, Sweden, Russia, Poland-Lithuania, and Prussia will fight for hegemony, using variable victory conditions that reflect their respective historical objectives. Gameplay involves collecting resources, building new infrastructure and units, recruiting historical figures to your court, and finally going to war to expand your empire and fulfil your national ambition.

Highlights:

Five asymmetric factions with unique abilities and objectives
A highly thematic deck of historical Dramatis Personae to constitute your royal court
A simple yet deep economic system that forces players to make tough decisions regarding their finances and wage war for key resources
A streamlined battle system based on custom dice per unit type
Variable player counts, from 2 to 5 players, and variable game lengths, with scenarios ranging from a tight duel to a diplomatic heavy conflict with alliances and betrayals


—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mythical Beings
boardgame.description:
A 2-player versus card game. Each player creates a team of 3 creatures, which will draw on allies and spells available in the market to deal damage to their opponents.
The game ends when one of the two players exhausts their initial 20 life points.
The strategy of combining the creatures, each with their own abilities, and the acquisition and play of the cards is decisive in winning a game.

boardgame.name: Eye of the Storm
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

This is an OSRIC adventure for characters of 3rd to 5th levels of experience.

The sleepy little coastal village of Sea Mist has a problem. A ship bringing important goods to the village is overdue. A major storm hit the coast earlier in the week and the village elders wonder weather the ship wrecked on the dangerous rocks nearby. But something far more sinister has occurred.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different, and watching out for turnips.
boardgame.description:
A speed/dexterity game that is about finding creatures that do NOT match.

Starting with all the cards face-down, players quickly flip over a card, which they may put into one hand as the first card in their stack. (You may flip another card if you wish.)

Everyone rushes to flip cards and find totally different creature - each card in your stack must be TOTALLY DIFFERENT to the one before - a different number of eyes, mouths, arms/wings/tentacles, and legs.

You may grab turnips - totally different to any creature! But if you have more than 5, you lose.

The game ends when everyone has grabbed as many cards as they can.

Pass your cards left to be checked. If you had 2 cards in a row that are similar, or more than 5 turnips, you lose.

Otherwise, the person with the most cards wins.


Grabbell reimplementation suggested by David Brain.

Turnip idea heavily inspired by Andrew Beardsley.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameintegration: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your RADISHES!
A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your RADISHES!

boardgame.name: Ceres
boardgame.description:
YEAR: 2219

The days of Earth being the center of humankind’s attention has ceased. The time of interplanetary spaceflights, space exploration and exploitation is already upon us.
MARS, having been terraformed and colonized for more than 50 years, facilitates, among others, the headquarters of the Asteroid Mining Assembly of Corporations (A.M.A.C.), a regulatory and corporate instrument of authority overseeing all issues that concern the Asteroid Mining Corporations.

CERES, the largest object in the asteroid belt stands as the last resort before the outer planets, a trading port established as the ultimate sign of stability within the chaos of the asteroid belt. Ceres is now the home of the Asteroid Mining Complex and its great establishment.

Take up the role of one of the Asteroid Mining Corporations. Plan and execute your company’s agendas, construct facilities, deploy mining probes in the asteroid belt, research for new technologies and exploit your power in the council of Mars.

CERES awaits you!

Ceres is a 1-4 Sci-Fi worker placement game where players take the role of an Asteroid Mining Corporation in the near future and try to outplay their opponents and rule Ceres! The game consists of 3 rounds that represent 3 years in Ceres and the respective full business cycles of the corporations. Players can choose among a variety of actions including launching mining probes to the Asteroid Belt, trading raw materials, constructing and upgrading their core facilities as well as expanding the colony of Ceres, improving their technology through research and liaising with the Mars council in order to exploit their power even more!
Ceres has been co-developed with an astrophysicist for the best possible thematic applications and brings a couple of innovative twists to the worker placement genre!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Divine Doctrines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

Pathfinder Second Edition brings a ton of cool classes and options to expand familiar classes like the cleric in new ways. No longer simply healers, clerics can specialize their domains but can go one step beyond in following their doctrines, expressing how they manifest their faith and their religious role! Your clerics can take on entirely new roles with the clever and cunning Agent, the relentlessly practical Cardinal, the zealous and militant Chosen of Arms, and the contemplative Philosopher and their experimental Font of Alchemy!

boardgame.name: Jesus Wept
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jesus Wept is the twentieth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the first in our Series Four series of zupplements, each detailing monstrous goodness.

Inside, you'll find:


We start off with a short story about a dancer. Don't want to spoil it, but it's cool as fuck. And another homage.
Then we introduce the Hellions kink. These are hunters that deal with the darkness directly, navigating the world of demons on the hunt.
Then we introduce the Devils clade. These aren't the demons from the core book. These are dark priests of temptation and damnation.
Then we wrap with five quick gigs to introduce some of the book's concepts in a practical fashion.

boardgame.name: In Wild Places
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Wild Places is a card-driven roleplaying game where 2 to 6 players collaborate to tell a story of a small group’s travel through dangerous wilderness.

A deck of multi-use cards provides story prompts and serves as a randomizer as needed: there is no Game Master, and no dice are needed.

Your story can take place in any world where people set out for perilous journeys. Four settings are suggested (modern, fantasy, scifi and post-apocalyptic), but you are also free to create your own.

boardgame.name: Die Fleischgärten von Carcosa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zwei Abenteuer, die sowohl mit der Mythos-Gottheit wie auch dem gleichnamigen Buch Der König in Gelb in Verbindung stehen:

Die Fleischgärten von Carcosa sind nichts für schwache Nerven! Die Investigatoren müssen in einer aus menschlichen Leichen geschaffenen Welt um ihr Überleben und ihren Verstand kämpfen, während sie permanent grauenhaften Wesenheiten und einer lebensfeindlichen Umgebung ausgeliefert sind. Zu junge oder zu sensible Spieler sollten sich ausdrücklich nicht in dieses Abenteuer stürzen!

Das Gelbe Zeichen ist für einen einzelnen Investigator konzipiert, dem durch Zufall eben dieses okkulte Kleinod in die Hände gefallen ist. Nun beginnt ein Wettlauf gegen die Zeit, denn der übernatürliche Hüter des Gelben Zeichens tötet jeden Besitzer des Artefakts!

boardgame.name: Abenteuer aus der Gruft III
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dieses Mal haben die redaktionellen Grabräuber dieser Serie in missionarischer Mission zwei ganz besondere Schätze für die Wiederveröffentlichung erbeutet:

Das Geheimnis des Schwarzwaldhofs aus dem Spielleiter-Handbuch, Dritte Edition (2012)

sowie

Die Rückkehr der Dunklen Engel aus Terra Cthulhiana (2008).
Diese Mischung wendet sich sowohl an Spielrunden, die ein besonders beliebtes Abenteuer erleben möchten, als auch an Spielleiter, denen daran gelegen ist, selbst auf Basis der geschilderten Gegebenheiten und Eckdaten eine ganz eigene Kampagne auszuarbeiten. Gruselgenuss und eigene Kreativität – das cthulhoide Duo Infernale!

Natürlich wurden sie dafür den Regeln der Edition 7 angepasst und teilweise erweitert.

boardgame.name: Horror Americana
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wie bereits in dem begehrten Terror Americana bilden die USA erneut die Bühne für zwei Trips ins Grauen:

Nicht alles, was leuchtet, ist ein Silberstreifen am Horizont.

Das einsteigerfreundliche Totes Licht kommt sofort zur Sache und bietet die Gelegenheit, im malerischen Lovecraft Country vorzeitig ins Gras zu beißen, während einem ein Licht aufgeht.

Während eine nächtlichen Unwetters müssen die Investigatoren um ihr Leben kämpfen. (1920er)

Nicht alles, was tötet, muss bereits die Wurzel des Übels sein.

Schreie und Flüstern richtet sich an erfahrenere Spielrunden und bezieht durch einen zum Schreien guten Spielmechanismus das Privatleben von zwei (maximal drei) polizeilichen Ermittlern in Chicago unmittelbar in die Abenteuerhandlung ein. (NOW)

boardgame.name: Les Charlatans de Belcastel: Mégabox
De Kwakzalvers van Kakelenburg: Mega Box
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: MegaBox
Die Quacksalber von Quedlinburg: MegaBox
boardgame.description:
This Mega Box includes the original The Quacks of Quedlinburg, The Herb Witches expansion and The Alchemists expansion, all in one box!

In The Quacks of Quedlinburg, players are charlatans — or quack doctors — each making their own secret brew by adding ingredients one at a time. Take care with what you add, though, for a pinch too much of this or that will spoil the whole mixture!

Each player has their own bag of ingredient chips. During each round, they simultaneously draw chips and add them to their pot. The higher the face value of the drawn chip, the further it is placed in the swirling pattern, increasing how much your potion is worth. Push your luck as far as you can, but if you add too many cherry bombs, your pot explodes!

At the end of each round, players gain victory points and coins to spend on new ingredients to add to their bags, depending on the strength of the ingredients in their pots. But players with exploded pots must choose points or coins — not both! The player with the most victory points at the end of nine rounds wins the game.

Included in this box are:

The Quacks of Quedlinburg: the base game
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches: the first expansion, adding Witches that grant powers once per game as well as more ingredient books.
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists: the second expansion introduces nightmares, obsession, hysteria and a new laboratory player board.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches

boardgame.name: Königsdaemmerung
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Die Sterne stehen günstig.

Hasturs Blick streift die Erde, und Dinge ändern sich!

Oktober 1928. London: Die Hauptstadt eines Reiches, das sich über ein Viertel des Erdballs erstreckt und in dem ein Viertel der Menschheit lebt. Die Bevölkerung ist mit Politik und Regierung, Finanz und Produktion, Arbeit und Freizeit beschäftigt.

Doch wie zerbrechlich das alles ist. Wie groß die Ignoranz ...

Der verderbliche Einfluss einer unmenschlichen Macht wirkt nach und nach wie nie zuvor. Zuerst spüren es die Empfindsamen und Schwachen; nur wenige können den Ursprung erahnen, manche heißen ihn dennoch willkommen. Künstler sehen seltsame Einflüsse in ihrem Werk und nutzen diesen Kreativitätsschub. Literatur und Theater zeigen Szenen des Aufruhrs und der Verwirrung. Und andere Menschen neigen zu Stimmungsschwankungen: Sie spüren, dass sich neue Wege auftun. Manche behaupten, dass Gott zu ihnen spreche.

Alle fühlen den Lockruf der Sterne.

Die Kampagne ist auf 4-6 Investigatoren zugeschnitten.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Salvage Box – Legendary
boardgame.description:
The BattleTech Legendary Salvage Box is a blind box containing one plastic miniature for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also contains the matching pilot card and Alpha Strike dry-erase card for the miniature.

The Battletech Legendary Salvage box was created as a part of the Clan Invasion Kickstarter 2019.

Each box contains one of the following miniatures & pilots determined randomly:


ARC-2R Archer (Morgan Kell)
Dire Wolf Widowmaker (Natasha Kerensky)
MAD-3R Marauder (Grayson "Death" Carlyle)
Timber Wolf (Aidan Pryde)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Marik
boardgame.description:
From back of Folio:
KEEP YOUR RECORDS STRAIGHT!

The MechWarrior Personnel File provides you with Battletech military data documents and serves as a storage folder for all your BattleTech papers. There are five different files - one for each of the five houses. Each file is printed in the appropriate House colors and contains components unique to that House. Plus your file can be personalized by you to fit your (or your characer's) individual background.

Here's what you get:

Colorful Storage Folder
Officer's Commission
House Recruiting Poster
'Mech Pilot Certificate
Letter from your House Leader
MechWarrior Service Record
After-action reports
Kill Stickers
Next of kin/Insurance Form
Radiation Detection Badge

boardgame.name: Cotton Trade: 1800-1860
boardgame.description:
It is the early 19th century. You are a British entrepreneur with only one goal on your mind. To benefit from an exponentially growing demand for cotton created by a rapid development of the textile industry. You will send your ships all over the world in search of the best bargain prices of this precious commodity. Will you keep up with the expanding market and seize the opportunity to become the most successful merchant?

The game is played over 9 rounds in 3 stages, each stage covering roughly 20 years. During each round players compare the wealth of their companies to determine current turn order, they rent ships, send ships to regions where cotton is harvested, buy cotton and return back to the United Kingdom to sell cotton with a profit. At the end of each round players pay a ship maintenance cost and clear the board preparing for the next round. Players can also benefit from transporting passengers and exporting small amounts of goods from the United Kingdom.

Game uses a deck of 24 ship cards with different properties where maximum capacity is the most important one. Cotton can be purchased from contract cards of different quantities and prices in four historical regions where cotton was harvested. Droughts and local wars can interrupt players' plans and along with the order of cards being drawn from the decks are the main random factor of the game. Ships are rented when only limited information about cotton harvests is available, adding to the difficulty of managing trading companies. Players can sell shares of their company to obtain additional funding but are requested to re-buy all their assets at the end of the game.

There are no victory points in this game. The player who owns the wealthiest company at the end wins the game.

Relative cotton prices and amounts of cotton harvested in different regions were based on real world economic data. In order to simulate exponential growth of the market the game rescales itself between stages. This allows to keep up with the cotton boom without a need to handle large amounts of coins and tokens. Advanced game rules among other options introduce the possibility of buying other players' shares. This way players can invest and profit from their competitors' success.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Age of Comics: The Golden Years
boardgame.description:
Age of Comics: The Golden Years Age of Comics: The Golden Years is a worker placement
management game in which players will run a publishing company during the golden age of comics (1938-54).

In each round the players, in turn, must position 4 meeples (workers called editors). They can choose 4 out of 6 spaces, called publishing tasks. There are 6 publishing tasks in total that can be performed in any order and lead to 6 specific player actions: hire, develop, ideas, print, sales, and royalties. When a player prints a comic book she must pay using monetary resources ($) + 2 identical token ideas and display, on the table, the comic book cover and, underneath, show both a writer and an artist card. The comics’ value (needed for collecting orders on the map) will be the sum of the value of its creatives (artist + writer). Each creative card has a value ranging from 1 to 3.

The game lasts 5 rounds. The objective of the game is to accumulate the highest number of fans, make money by publishing comics and create the best portfolio of comic books. There are three main ways to accumulate fans:

being the first to publish a specific genre and specializing in it;
publishing comic books with specialized creatives;
collecting orders on the map.


Throughout the game, a fan chart will track the number of fans accumulated by the comics and will award victory points based on the players’ ranking at the end of every round. In the last round, the number of fans is converted into victory points. The money accumulated is instead divided by 4.

The winner is the player who scores the most victory points (VP from now on, represented by a star icon)
at the end of five rounds.VP are awarded both during and at the end of the game by:
• Publishing original comic books
• Accumulating fans
• Being at the top of the comic book chart every round
• Earning money (but pay attention to taxes)
• Generating ideas
• Improving the printing quality

boardgame.name: Mitarra - The Agenda of Itherelle: Centepedes!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Mitarra! An isolated bastion of human civilization keeping the flame of culture alight in a dark world. Mitarra is also a society unaware of a creeping darkness coming from beyond its borders. A plan is in place; and agenda has been set; and Mitarra is its focus.

boardgame.name: Piece by Piece
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Daedalus Robotics Lab is in lockdown after personnel were fatally compromised in a random incident. Reports are linking the events to a work tool found at the scene, now classified as Artifact 21.

Daedalus Robotic Lab’s parent company, Jensen-Hung, is excited to offer an attractive opportunity to any self-motivated freelancers in the sector! Taking on the important role of Temporary Maintenance Crew, contractees are tasked with retrieving Artifact 21 for analysis. Caution is advised; discretion is enforced.

Piece by Piece is the fifth Mothership pamphlet module and includes:

A fully playable, ready-to-run one shot to drop in to any sci-fi RPG campaign
A Murder mystery in a robotics laboratory.
An easy to read map and key.
Five NPCs to interact with as well as a strange new artifact to collect (or fear).


This adventure is suitable for characters of any level in a survival horror setting and is sure to pose a challenge to even the most battle hardened party.

boardgame.name: The Butcher's War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party finds themselves in command of a sailing ship, they must voyage across the sea in an effort to stop a rogue admiral with dreams of conquest. Along the way they will fight pirates, hunt for mysterious arcane shards and assemble a military force to resist the admiral’s growing fleet.

The Butcher’s War is an intermediate or advanced adventure supplement for Age of Ambition. It features a naval wartime and treasure hunting scenario, and is designed to run between three and five gaming sessions.

boardgame.name: Skyraiders of Abarax: Skyraiders Handbook
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Skyraider's Handbook is the player's guide to the creation of their character's ancestries, cultures and professions as well as the magic in the world and the skills required to sail the skies.

boardgame.name: Skyraiders of Abarax: Skymaster's Almanac
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Skymaster's Almanac is exclusively intended for the gamemaster providing knowledge of how to conduct the Skyraider's adventure campaign and about the greater world - to a point. As the players push back the horizon through their adventures, so, too, is that same horizon of understanding pushed back for the gamemaster, allowing everyone to participate in a journey of discovery.

boardgame.name: Skyraiders of Abarax: Complete Set
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Collector's Set is a slipcased set of hardcover books, published separately as:

Skyraiders of Abarax: Skyraiders Handbook
Skyraiders of Abarax: Skymaster's Almanac

boardgame.name: The Gigantic Eye That Is Also An Aviary
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In the clouds above the city, the crystalline eye of the Panoptic Aviary sees and remembers. Inside, a thousand birds report the gossip and rumours they have learnt on their travels throughout the human world and the scribes of The Order of Whispers write them down.

Selling the knowledge to the highest bidder, The Order’s clients include members of the court, blackmailers of all sorts, detectives of the city, and the state security apparatus. What is it that takes you there today?

The Gigantic Eye That Is Also An Aviary is a pocket place about a secret order of spies, their birds, and the giant floating eye they live in.

boardgame.name: Champions of the Fractal Palace
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A downloadable funnel adventure for Troika!

In a forgotten corner of the city of Troika stands the Fractal Palace. Bejewelled with iridescent white crystal, vast but folded into a single city block, the place is a maze of rooms within rooms, twisted self-similar passageways, and a thousand illusionary geometries. By its nature, it cannot be mapped - it is a living mass of shifting angles and scales. Some say that it is impossible to leave the same way that you entered.

At the centre of the palace lives it's champion, maintaining the balance of the palace’s transformations. And yet, the palace has become unstable, shifting through chaotic and barely navigable configurations. Suddenly, it is pushing against the city, interpenetrating surrounding buildings, unfolding fleeting entrance portals across every part of town. The city guard has sealed it off. Why is the palace acting like this? What has become of the champion? As newly deputised guards, it's down to you to find out!

This is a funnel adventure for the Troika! roleplaying game in a mini-zine format. You play four characters at the same time exploring the palace and trying to solve the mystery of its sudden transformations. The palace is procedurally generated and changes when the players aren't looking. Those who survive will become Champions of the Fractal Palace.

boardgame.name: The Crimson Prism
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A galaxy-wide famous starship, roughly the size of a freight train. Offering exclusive galaxy tours to the rich, famous and ostentatious.

However, the signal of life support has just gone dead, radio signals have been silent and now you...are tasked with seeking what happened.

Onboard this galactic star train, was none other than Archduke Bishop Longsocks. A famous oligarch whose private security are paying you to save him...and him alone.

His signal went dead within the starship's buffet car. To get there you must dock 4 sections away for no other reason apart from the plot.

Make your way through the car until you reach the buffet car and find the Archduke!

boardgame.name: Galaxy Eater
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The galaxy eater doesn't apply to the logic of our world or dimension. Tearing through a gateway into a trepid world of despair, it now feasts on the dwindling sanity of anyone foolish enough to cross its path. Largely incorporeal, it is difficult for the lacklustre mind of your average dungeon diver to conceive such a creature, building on images one has seen before in the real world, leaves too many cracks and can shatter the mind.

The galaxy eater will follow the PC's until it has drained them of their sanity. It will not attack physically but mentally instead. Unleashing a torrent of horror into their psyche like a festering untreated wound.

It isn't set in stone where the galaxy eater will appear, he could manifest in a random cave or dungeon, even on the streets of Galgenbeck. Regardless, he will appear and he will devour the galaxy.

boardgame.name: Family Affairs
boardgame.description:
There are many secrets hidden in this big old city. But the main one is vampires. A hundred years ago there were so many of them here, and they behaved so openly and brazenly that people declared a hunt for them. The angry crowd caught all the bloodsuckers and buried them with aspen stakes in their chests. And this was forgotten for many years. But a small group of vampires managed to escape. For a hundred years they wandered around the world, and it's time to return to their hometown to resurrect their deceased relatives.

In the game Family Affairs, players will take on the role of the heads of vampire families. Their task is to resurrect as many of their blood-sucking relatives as possible in six nights. To do this, you need to find as many tombstones as possible. Then dig up the bodies and give the poor fellows fresh blood to drink.
Capturing cemeteries will help your family complete the mission faster, but you should be wary of fanatical Vampire Hunters.

Family Affairs is a roll and write game. In it, you will take on the role of vampire families who are looking for their long-dead relatives. There are eight vampire families to choose from in the game, each of which gives you a unique gaming experience. The main task of the game is to paint over as many graves with vampires as possible, resurrecting them. To do this, you will need to find the tombstones first.

Gameplay: throw dice and try to throw "6" on them - i.e. resurrect a vampire and not throw "1" - i.e. stumble upon a Vampire Hunter.

Each turn you will capture a new cemetery. Each captured cemetery will give you new opportunities for the rest of the game. For example, to throw more dice or resurrect vampires not only by "6", but also by "5". The head of the vampire family must skillfully decide which cemetery to capture first and which to leave for later. The opportunity to make Sorties brings more excitement. You can double all the resurrected vampires, but at the same time reduce the number of Vampire Hunters from whom your family can hide.

You have only six moves to assemble a well-functioning game engine and win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Box of Power
boardgame.description:
Contains all the exclusive stretch goals unlocked during the Clash for Eternia Kickstarter, including a box to store everything.

Stretch goals and daily reveals included:

Heroic Warriors (16)
Evil Warriors (16)
NPCS (3)
alternate Warrior models (12)
3D plants + terrain tokens
curve overlays
cross overlays
token containers
lesson cards
Holiday + Revenge of the Doppelgangers scenarios
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Crocs' Socks!
boardgame.description:
Oh oh, the crocodile's missing a sock! Who is the fastest and finds his matching sock so that Kroko has a complete pair again? The Crocs' Socks! game is an active board game for children and parents. You play it with one to four players. The game consists of cards with coloured socks, cards with a crocodile with only one sock on and four ploppers. One of the participants turns over a card and then everyone tries to catch the missing sock with the plopper as quickly as possible. But watch out! Does Kroko need a left or right sock?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: NeMoren's Vault: Revised (d20)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

NeMoren's Vault: Revised expands and revises NeMoren's Vault (d20) from d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.0 Compatible) to d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.5 Compatible).

boardgame.name: A Quiet Place
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Game set in the universe from the movies.User Summary

boardgame.name: Ultima Ratio
boardgame.description:
from the backcover of the german pdf/print version
Die Explosion des Zeppelins Hindenburg am 6. Mai 1937 während der Landung in Lakehurst ist eine der bekanntesten technischen Katastrophen der letzten einhundert Jahre. 36 Menschen, darunter ein Mitglied der Bodenmannschaft, starben bei dem Unglück. Fast wie durch ein Wunder überlebten 39 Besatzungsmitglieder und 23 Passagiere, teils mit schweren Verbrennungen. Über die bis heute ungeklärten Ursachen gibt es zahlreiche Spekulationen ...

Ultima Ratio ist ein One-Shot für drei Charaktere, das im Jahr 1937 die finalen Stunden der Reise des deutschen Luftschiffes nachempfindet. Mit etwa einer Stunde Spieldauer mag es kurz erscheinen, die Intensität ist dafür um so explosiver.

Ultima Ratio ist ein Szenario für FHTAGN, dem Horror-Rollenspielsystem der Deutschen Lovecraft Gesellschaft.

english translation
The explosion of the Zeppelin Hindenburg on May 6, 1937, during its landing at Lakehurst is one of the most famous technical disasters of the last one hundred years. 36 people, including one member of the ground crew, died in the accident. Almost miraculously, 39 crew members and 23 passengers survived, some with severe burns. There are numerous speculations about the causes, which remain unexplained to this day ...

Ultima Ratio is a one-shot for three characters that recreates the final hours of the German airship's journey in 1937. With about an hour of gameplay, it may seem short, but the intensity is all the more explosive for it.

Ultima Ratio is a scenario for FHTAGN, the horror roleplaying system of the German Lovecraft Society (Deutsche Lovecraft Gesellschaft).

boardgame.name: Mean Streets '79
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

MEAN STREETS ‘79 is a stripped-down, minimalist RPG designed to emulate the gonzo action and bad one-liners of the 1970s buddy-cop action movie genre, although it works just as well for recreating buddy-cop action TV shows. And they say today’s games lack variety...

boardgame.name: Balkan Railways
boardgame.description:
Balkan Railways - the first expansion for Iberian Railways - stretches from Istanbul to Trieste, from Albania to Romania on two 11x17 inch color maps.

19 new Business Interest cards are supplied, as are the Special Rules for Balkan Railways. Among other elements, the player opening the Orient Express (rail connection from Trieste to Istanbul) receives a bonus, as do the railroads used in the route. The terrain in the Balkans is tough, and hexes are Mountains, Hills or Clear.
 
The game is for 3-5 players, takes about an hour, with one page of expansion rules. The expansion can be used with either the Winsome original Iberian Railways game or the Rio Grande licensed Iberian Railways game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Helm Greycastle #1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HELM GREYCASTLE #1 includes a Latinx one-shot RPG (5E compatible) written by TRISTAN J. TARWATER (Rolled & Told) and art by JEN VAUGHN.

boardgame.name: Helm Greycastle #2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Team up with Helm Greycastle in this issue's one-shot RPG (5E OGL) "BELLY OF THE BEAST" by GEOFFREY GOLDEN (Wet Hot American Summer Fantasy Camp) & JEN VAUGHN!

boardgame.name: Helm Greycastle #3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue includes a Latinx action-adventure RPG (5E Compatible) one-shot by TRISTAN J. TARWATER (Rolled & Told)!

boardgame.name: Helm Greycastle #4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Last one-shot (5E Compatible) RPG written by MATT HAWKINS (THINK TANK) for new or experienced players!

boardgame.name: Docks of Caswarren
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Docks of Caswarren is a legacy sandbox adventure landscape useable with any Fantasy RPG

You decide the impact that the beautifully detailed locations will have on the game

Docks of Caswarren is a complete sandbox setting that features:


16 locations, each incorporating three selectable legacy story options - you chose the story element that lends itself to the story you want to tell and that then becomes your version of Caswarren.
Four factions designed to help promote story building
A list of common names and common beverages


The map remains the same, but the adventure landscape just changed forever.

boardgame.name: Mythos Pack 2: Mythic Ireland
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Mythic Ireland is a fantasy setting for the Deluxe Tunnels and Trolls roleplaying game. It is a grittier, humancentric world that might have existed several centuries before the start of Irish history. This work draws heavily from many sources—textbooks, scholarly articles, mythology, historical accounts, fantasy fiction, historical fiction, my numerous visits to Ireland, and still others. Much herein reflects simplification to promote understanding, and, frankly, some of it I fabricated in the absence of anything concrete. That said, please do not look for historical (or linguistic) accuracy.

boardgame.name: Neldark
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Quando l’inferno scese sulla terra, iniziò la nostra Era. Si narra che fu per colpa dell’uomo che ciò avvenne, e fra tutti gli esseri del creato fu quello che pagò le pene peggiori.

In principio una luce bianca emerse dal ventre della Terra. La coltre di fiamme avvolse il globo e i serpenti di magma tranciarono i vecchi continenti. Gli echi delle tribolazioni dei popoli riempirono l’aria per un tempo che nessuno poté mai misurare

boardgame.name: Fourth Precinct
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This project presents another pair of location-based maps on either side of a 24 x 36-inch digital poster. The first location is the 4th Precinct, which is a multi-purpose law enforcement complex. It includes a police station, a courthouse, and a jail all in one compact facility. The other side of the poster presents a spacious warehouse packed with a variety of barrels, boxes, and crates. There's a loading dock outside, and offices plus a studio apartment upstairs in the back. Both facilities include small basement areas for additional encounters.

The maps are designed so that the warehouse can be next door to the precinct or across the street. These maps also match up with the earlier offerings in this series (the L7 Bar & Grill, House Overlund, etc.). The supporting digital document includes room-by-room descriptions and a general overview of the locations. This product could also be used for modern-day adventures as well as near-future and sci-fi settings.

boardgame.name: Anderson Place
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Live, work, and play in the heart of District Seven!

The fifth offering in the 0hr Sci-Fi Settings product line presents two pairs of digital poster images and supporting documents that layout a high-rise with office, condo, and penthouse levels. The maps are at 1 inch = 5 feet scale and have a 1 inch grid built in – perfect for Starfinder and other science fiction RPGs.

The maps present the entire building. There's a spacious lobby on the ground floor with a gym and snack shop on the mezzanine level overlooking the foyer. Above this are two floors of office space, three levels of condos, and a couple of utility levels. The entire top floor is a spacious penthouse with a private pool and landing pad on the roof.

The plaza contains a large fountain surrounded by a park bordered with a collection of food stands and some public restrooms. Behind the building is a "Parking Pit", which consists of a ground-level lot plus several subterranean levels (accessed via lifts for vehicles that are not grav-enabled).

A transit tube runs behind the high-rise with stops at the ground and mezzanine levels. This can connect Anderson Place to Port Leonis, or can represent a more generic means of urban mass transit. This building and plaza are designed to sit next to the port and to complete the area laid out in the 0-hr Sci-Fi settings up to this point.

boardgame.name: Small Railroad Empires: Freight on Board
boardgame.description:
Freight on Board is a new mini-expansion for Small Railroad Empires in which players will be able to export cargo containers via ships in port!

When a player delivers a good along their train route, if they match the good displayed on the Cargo Ship card, they will be able to place their own Cargo Container there. When the ship is full, it will sail away to export those goods, and the player that put the most containers on that ship will win the export and gain extra Prestige & Money!

boardgame.name: Tiger & Dragon
boardgame.description:
Players in Tiger & Dragon play tiles from their hand to participate in waves of attack and defense. Be the first player to empty your hand to score points based on whichever one of ten scoring cards are in use this round.

The game contains 38 tiles: 36 numbered tiles with one 1, two 2s, etc. up to eight 8s, along with a tiger and a dragon. Shuffle the tiles face down, then each player takes tiles based on the player count, with the round's starting player taking one additional tile. With four players, for example, the starting player draw ten tiles and all other players nine. At least one tile will remain out of play.

The start player attacks by playing a tile from their hand. The next player can either pass or defend the attack by playing the same tile. Note that the dragon defends against any odd-numbered tile and the tiger against any even-numbered tile. After defending, place a tile of your own to attack. If a player passes, the next player either passes or defends. If all other players pass on your attack, place a tile from your hand face down, then choose a new tile to attack again. If you attack with the dragon or tiger, a player can defend with any odd- or even-numbered tile, respectively.

The first player to empty their hand wins the round and scores points based on the last tile that they played and the specific scoring card for that round. They score 1 bonus point for each time an attack of theirs went undefended. At the end of a round, if a player has scored 10+ points, they win.

Tiger & Dragon is based on the popular Japanese traditional game GOITA, and it can be played with team rules like that earlier team. Teammates sit across from one another, and the first team to collectively score 15+ points wins.

boardgame.name: Motley Dice
boardgame.description:
Motley Dice is an intriguing puzzle where you roll the dice to generate a unique challenge for every game. Then you must try to place as many dice as you can into the grid, following certain placement restrictions. Challenge yourself, or try one of four different play modes to cooperate or compete with your friends.

To pack some extra punch, this mint tin comes with rules for four other dice games you can play with the 25 dice included. That's 5 games in your pocket!

—description from the designer
